<@US74TEQ3E>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `wunderkind api integration`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `We've noticed that in November and December, there has been a significant drop-off in the number of lead emails being collected by Wunderkind compared to what is showing in the newsletter_subscription_confirmation API.


Wunderkind is investigating this and had a few questions that I wanted to see if you can help answer:

1. For emails that were captured by WKND but not passed to the API, can you advise whether the endpoint
<https://www.thepetstable.com/gw/api/newsletter/subscription>
may return an HTTP status code between 200â€“204 or 422 in cases where the email is not actually accepted or is considered a duplicate? At this time, they are treating 422 responses as duplicates and want to confirm that this aligns with how they should be interpreting the API responses to ensure accurate tracking.

2. Can you confirm whether the API may also reject emails under any other conditions they should be aware of? For example, the email below has a bunch of utm params and may go over the character limit for the origin_path API field.

<mailto:joyce.ramoscma@gmail.com|joyce.ramoscma@gmail.com>

origin_path value = /plans-quiz?c=AN-6U49I+&utm_source=facebook%7Efirstmedia&utm_medium=cpm&utm_campaign=FirstMedia_Meta_Prospecting_BAU_60FS1010&utm_content=act_native_metanative&fbclid=IwZXh0bgNhZW0BMABhZGlkAaswOnUFBrVzcnRjBmFwcF9pZAo2NjI4NTY4Mzc5AAEeBmhxTZvyFa2Hs1q2nTSphZKa-hqsZAuPe2NPKk1ftJ0sVtI8gulr2yT_gQE_aem_ZGbyQ91tSYCZSBTC778PQg&utm_id=120242422571370197_v2_s04&utm_term=120242422571370197&_gl=1*1h9sima*FPAU*Mzc5MjY4OTg5LjE3NjM5MjkzMzQ.*_ga*NjkyNzEzNDkuMTc2NDYyNzkyMg..*_ga_EEJN924K2Y*czE3NjQ2Mjc5MjEkbzEkZzAkdDE3NjQ2Mjc5MjEkajYwJGwwJGgyMTM2MDY4OTYw`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
Based on the provided context, here's what we can infer about the Wunderkind API integration issue:

1. The correct endpoint for Green Chef's newsletter subscription API is:
   `<https://www.greenchef.com/gw/api/newsletter/subscription/{email}>`

2. Wunderkind was using an outdated endpoint:
   `<https://chef.greenchef.com/gw/api/newsletter/subscription/{email}>`

3. The outdated endpoint was returning 301 errors, causing email submissions to fail.

To resolve the issue:

1. Wunderkind needs to update their integration to use the correct endpoint with the `www` subdomain.
2. This change is necessary as the primary domain has been using `<http://www.greenchef.com|www.greenchef.com>` for over 6 months.

It's important to note that this issue was causing a negative customer experience and impacting both short-term conversions and long-term lead cycles.

For more details, please visit <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FXKK7FS4/p1677708944493809?thread_ts=1677708944.493809&utm_source=slack-commander|here>
 :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@US74TEQ3E>? Unified Search :mag: button

<@U03UN2C25UL>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Question about newsletter/subscription API`
*Priority:* `High priority ðŸ”´`
*Market:* `Other`
*Environment:* `Live / Production`
*Platform:* `Web`
*Topic:* `Communication Platform General (e.g. request access)`
*Description:* `Hello team,
We are reaching out in the name of The Pets Table squad as we got an urgent request from one of our marketing stakeholders.
There seems to be a significant drop in leads in November and December compared to the previous months. The marketing team has reached out to the Wunderkind support, but this team had some questions about the API integration and they want to know how the newsletter/subscription endpoint works.
1. Can you advise whether the endpoint <https://www.thepetstable.com/gw/api/newsletter/subscription>
may return an HTTP status code between 200â€“204 or 422 in cases where the email is not actually accepted or is considered a duplicate? At this time, they are treating 422 responses as duplicates and want to confirm that this aligns with how they should be interpreting the API responses to ensure accurate tracking.
2. Does the string fields (path, origin, source, medium, etc_ under origin_metadata) have any character limits?
I understand you might have reduced capacity like us, but I'd appreciate if someone could help us before the holidays as the marketing team is worried that there might be a significant loss in the number of leads passing to sfmc, which would impact email performance/conversions
Thank you!`
*Impact:* `Potention loss of marketing leads`
*Steps to reproduce issue:* `n/a`
*Investigation steps already taken:* `n/a`

*Category:* comms-platform-support
*Command:* communication-platform-issue

elements.text: Guhan and I were investigating it and
we reached out to the respective backend team
asking for clarification. I've let them know about the urgency of this, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear back from them.

_thread_replies.text: thanks so much!

Good morning Lindsay,
The team that owns the API got back to us with the API documentation. This contains all info on how the API works and it should be enough for the Wunderkind team to continue with their investigation. <https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CMT/pages/5352685592/Newsletter+Subscription+API+for+Lead+Ingestion|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CMT/pages/5352685592/Newsletter+Subscription+API+for+Lead+Ingestion>
Some additional context you can provide to them is that when investigating yesterday we found that there might be a misunderstanding from the Wunderkind team as we don't send `origin_path` value on the request. What we send though is a value to the `path` field, and the implementation on the frontend simply gets the value from `window.location.pathname` which ignores both host and any params on the url. We also checked the <https://subscriber-preferences-service.staging-k8s.hellofresh.io/|API contract> itself and it doesn't mention an `origin_path`. But just like the frontend, the API's `path` field does not seem to have any character limitations, it just expects a string.

_thread_replies.text: cc <@U03UMPD2NNS>

:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To update the RAF landing page copy:

1. Open the provided Google Docs link on Monday, 12/22
2. Update the following information:
   - Change the friend discount to *75%-10%-10%*
   - Modify any related copy to reflect this new discount structure

3. Ensure consistency across all sections of the landing page
4. Double-check for any mentions of the old discount structure and update accordingly

Remember to:
- Use clear and concise language
- Maintain the existing tone and style of the page
- Preview changes to ensure proper formatting

For more details, please visit <https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/19KC-DlES4k9e9RGWmWVBq6BVwQ-wSc_Q3MAMfh7yQ-0/edit?usp=sharing|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C087SSKV4JF/p1747954542775149?thread_ts=1747954542.775149&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Updating RAF Page Header on CF>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C026TKVLHJP/p1695307264852859?thread_ts=1695307264.852859&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] /pages/freebies_offline Landing Pages for GC US and EP US> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

_thread_replies.text: (maybe I missed it)

the 1/8 portion is not something we have in a general distribution logic, so we are overriding the portioning for 60kcal SKUs.
The 2250 SKUs do not need this portion (quite small portion), as far as I understand, so it follows a general distribution logic.

_thread_replies.text: one more qq; the calories range in `toolbox/commands/kn-box-model-builder/dictionaries/primitives.ts` contain kcal 2100 - we currently do not have this SKU/calorie  - is this something that will be added later?

_thread_replies.text: highest we've got is 1850
and then in the next year we'll have 2250

elements.text: and then in the next year we'll have 2250

_thread_replies.text: The 2100 is an artificial calorie range for KN-*FR*-1-1850-0 SKUs. In the box model, we calculate the box content as if it were 2100 (don't ask me why) - that's why we have this calorie range defined.

elements.text: The 2100 is an artificial calorie range for KN-*FR*-1-1850-0 SKUs. In the box model, we calculate the box content as if it were 2100 (don't ask me why) - that's why we have this calorie range defined.

_thread_replies.text: I have an idea how we can potentially use overrides differently (overrides packs instead of calorie range) to avoid potential confusion around this
